com.alexgilleran.icesoap.parser

Interface XPathPullParser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    XPathPullParserImpl

    public interface XPathPullParser
    Wrapper around XmlPullParser that keeps track of the current element in XPath form. Only a few methods of XmlPullParser are supported. Note that unlike the standard XmlPullParser, this treats attributes as an event in the same sense as a node.
    Author:
    Alex Gilleran

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int ATTRIBUTE
      Indicates that the current event is an attribute value.
      static int END_DOCUMENT
      Indicates that the current event is the end of a document.
      static int END_TAG
      Indicates that the current event is the end of a tag.
      static int START_DOCUMENT
      Indicates that the current event is the start of a document.
      static int START_TAG
      Indicates that the current event is the start of a tag.
      static int TEXT
      Indicates that the current event is a text value.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentValue

        String getCurrentValue()
        Get the String value of the current node, whether attribute or text. For a text node, this will move to the end of the text node after getting the value. Note that if the event is ATTRIBUTE, this will only ever return the value of the attribute - get the name with getCurrentElement().
        Returns:
        The string value of the current node.

      • next

        int next()
         throws XMLParsingException
        Delegates to XmlPullParser.next() - gets the next event from the pull parser. Note that although this is much the same as XmlPullParser.next(), this treats attribute values as events in their own right, rather than just tags. Attribute events will return the value ATTRIBUTE.
        Returns:
        The type of the next event, as an int.
        Throws:
        XMLParsingException - If an error is encountered in the XML.
        See Also:
        XmlPullParser.next()

      • getCurrentElement

        XPathElement getCurrentElement()
        Gets the current element being passed, as an XPathElement.
        Returns:
        the current XPath

      • getEventType

        int getEventType()
                 throws org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException
        Gets the type of the current event. Be aware that although this delegates to XmlPullParser.getEventType() in most cases, on attribute values it will return ATTRIBUTE, which is specific to this interface.
        Returns:
        The current event type as an int - compare with the public constants in this class.
        Throws:
        org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException - If an error is encountered in the XML.

      • setInput

        void setInput(InputStream inputStream,
            String inputEncoding)
              throws org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException
        Sets the input for this parser.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The input stream to set.
        inputEncoding - The encoding of the stream - null will attempt auto-detection.
        Throws:
        org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullParserException - If an error is encountered in the XML.
        See Also:
        XmlPullParser.setInput(java.io.InputStream, java.lang.String)

      • isCurrentValueXsiNil

        boolean isCurrentValueXsiNil()
        Checks if the current element has the xsi:nil attribute.
        Returns:
        Whether it does.
